body: @murong00 can you create a PR and maybe i can contribute to it?

@cuzyoucant It seems there is no `brokerClientAutheticationPlugin` and `brokerClientAuthenticationParameters` in your proxy configuration file, I think you might need to configure them in the proxy as well.
ping @wenjun8888 , will close this issue, If you have any questions about this, please reopen it or let me know, thanks.

@zymap They are set. I just double checked. Sorry i missed those. I got the config file in a very weird formatted way and i just copy/pasted everything that i thought was related to TLS.

Like i mentioned above, when i pass in a dummy token everything works as expected. As soon as the proxy gets its first request it notices that he token is invalid and gets a new one from our OAuth provider.
@addisonj could you please help check the content from L206-208? (or L194-236) Any comment is highly appreciated.

1. What does "the function shares a namespace and potentially schedule across clusters." mean in L280?
2. In the sentence "if you use tokens that expire when deploying functions, these tokens will expire.", I was wondering when those token expire: expire when deploying functions, or after deploying, or a short period after deploying? Is the action encouraged? If a user uses expired token when deploying functions, what's the effects/results? Will it affect production environment?
3. While refining the content throughout, I found that we need to update the content in v2.6.0-v2.6.2 as well. When the update in the master is ready, will update those in v2.6.x as well.

I've just pushed a PR #7996 to support key based batching. There're a lot of changes so it may take some time to review.

You can see [KeySharedConsumerTest.cc](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/bf55c95b5ff65e7ed2eb78617f2e183b77d47aa4/pulsar-client-cpp/tests/KeySharedConsumerTest.cc) as an example. Just change the batching type of producer:

```c++
            ProducerConfiguration()                                                //
                .setBatchingType(ProducerConfiguration::KeyBasedBatching)          //
                /* set other configs... */
```
Thanks @Jennifer88huang for the suggestions I took some verbatim and others I tweaked a little bit.
@david-streamlio Would you please help resolve the conflicts with master branch?
@Renkai Thanks for contribute to this feature, Is this still in Draft status?

@alexku7 Thanks for your feedback. I can't reproduce this issue on my laptop. When I try to delete the partitioned topic and the producers still publishing messages to this topic. The request is rejected by 

```
09:13:48.095 [AsyncHttpClient-7-1] WARN  org.apache.pulsar.client.admin.internal.BaseResource - [http://localhost:8080/admin/v2/persistent/public/default/xyz/partitions?force=false] Failed to perform http delete request: javax.ws.rs.ClientErrorException: HTTP 412 Precondition Failed
Topic has active producers/subscriptions

Reason: Topic has active producers/subscriptions
```

Then I close all producers and recreate the partitioned topic

```
bin/pulsar-admin topics create-partitioned-topic persistent://public/default/xyz -p 2
```
This topic has 3 partitions previously.

Then I restart the producers:

```
09:14:13.035 [pulsar-client-io-2-10] INFO  org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.ProducerImpl - [persistent://public/default/xyz-partition-0] [standalone-0-3] Created producer on cnx [id: 0xcdb35d20, L:/127.0.0.1:56325 - R:localhost/127.0.0.1:6650]
```

The producer works well.
@kellyfj thank you very much for your contribution.
@otmanel31 Thanks for reporting this issue, This looks like a race condition, we should remove the check in method: `MultiTopicsConsumerImpl.doSubscribeTopicPartitions`.

Hi
I didn't restart the producers between re-creating the topics.
The producers are running always. I think that it's expected that the producer can recover and reconnect without restarting the them after the topics has been recreated with fewer number of partitions

Hi

After additional investigation it seems that we had some race condition in our client code. We are still checking it but for now i thing we can put this issue on hold
Thank for your time
Not yet, i will work on it in next weekend. you can do it  if you are urgent

Hi @sijie 
Do you know what can be wrong? We're using almost unchanged pulsar kubernetes chart on AKS, but this should be visible rather on any cloud. 
Only important changes in helm values are:
    managedLedgerDefaultEnsembleSize: "3"
    managedLedgerDefaultWriteQuorum: "3"
    managedLedgerDefaultAckQuorum: "2"
in broker configuration. We tested also with:
    managedLedgerDefaultEnsembleSize: "3"
    **managedLedgerDefaultWriteQuorum: "2"**
    managedLedgerDefaultAckQuorum: "2"

But with no success.
Terminating single pods of zookeepers, brokers, bookies, proxies seems to not cause problems. Problems seems to exist only when different types of pods exist on single node and we are calling kubectl drain <node>.

We too have been hit by this issue trying to send generics
```
public class InteractionEvent<T>
```
I will work on this conflicts shortly.
@rauluka which version are you using? 2.5.x or 2.6.x?

It's might cause by the PR https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/7998.

And I see when changing the pom file, the CI is not running to check the PR.
found the same root cause. need to also fix the "change docs only" script, because it is not worked right for only pom.xml change.
@sijia-w @Huanli-Meng please help review the content, any comment is highly appreciated.
@fracasula Is the new image works for you? Any problems please ping me.

I checked the sidebars.json file in the master branch, compared it with sidebars.json in the versioned_sidebars folder, and did not find notable format issues. 
I'm not sure whether it has anything to do with the sidebar.json file, or some other files related to build?

> @Renkai Thanks for contribute to this feature, Is this still in Draft status?

Main idea to fix this issue changed a lot, I will create a new PR.
@congbobo184 @gaoran10 Would you please help review this PR?

@codelipenghui @sijie I reproduced the issue accidentally. If the broker's `allowAutoTopicCreationType` is `partitioned`, then the automatically created topic has no schema.

It's easy to reproduce:
1. Run a consumer to subscribe a topic that doesn't exist now, e.g.

    ```java
            try (Consumer<byte[]> consumer = client.newConsumer() //
                    .topic("PulsarBar") // PulsarBar doesn't exist
                    .subscriptionName("my-sub") //
                    .subscribe()) {
    ```

2. Check the topic's schema

    ```bash
    $ ./bin/pulsar-admin schemas get "persistent://public/default/PulsarBar"
    HTTP 404 Not Found

    Reason: HTTP 404 Not Found
    $ ./bin/pulsar-admin schemas get "persistent://public/default/PulsarBar-partition-0"
    HTTP 404 Not Found

    Reason: HTTP 404 Not Found
    ```

The broker logs:

```
11:36:15.409 [ForkJoinPool.commonPool-worker-25] INFO  org.eclipse.jetty.server.RequestLog - 10.208.65.74 - - [09/Sep/2020:11:36:15 +0800] "GET /admin/v2/schemas/public/default/PulsarBar/schema?authoritative=true HTTP/1.1" 404 0 "-" "Pulsar-Java-v2.6.0" 4
```
Is it normal this series of failures ?
@BewareMyPower If you have identified the problem, are you interested in contributing a fix?
@sijie Yes, I'll take some time to look into the problem.

> @fracasula Is the new image works for you? Any problems please ping me.

@codelipenghui yeah the last image is definitely working, thanks! I haven't got back to you because I'm off till next week and had troubles replicating the "silent broker" issue, it's quite random and hard to replicate. I think most of the times we had stuck consumers was due to client issues (Golang deadlock).

Hi @sijie 

We're using Pulsar 2.6.0 with 2.6.1-1 chart.
@mkozioro Did you kill the leader zookeeper when you kill the zookeeper pod?
@gaoran10 @congbobo184 Which of you have time to take a look at this issue?
@sijie yes, we kill the leader zookeeper, however the new leader is choosen immediately (according to logs around 200ms).

@frankjkelly Now we can use the client of python 2.6.1 normally

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20965307/92573881-f8c84480-f2b8-11ea-9ad5-7b564983f0c4.png)

> It seems to me that there's an issue in the env that is building the wheel files. We're publishing both `pulsar_client-2.6.0-cp37-cp37m-macosx_10_15_x86_64.whl` as well as `pulsar_client-2.6.0-cp38-cp38m-macosx_10_15_x86_64.whl` but both seem to be built with Boost-Python3.8.

Yes, this is because we use the boost-python38 lib to build the python37 version. I modified a [`boost-python3.rb`](https://github.com/streamnative/homebrew-streamnative/blob/master/Formula/boost-python3.rb) file to build the boost-python37 lib, which may solve our problem.
@cuzyoucant Finally, I reproduce this issue on my local and fix it here #8019. Feel free to take a look and left comments.

Could you please help verify without message batching? I suspect to the batch message and I have verified on my laptop(2.6.1). So I can confirm if they are the same issue.

close this issue for not meet this issue anymore.
